name: Acute Diverticulitis with Localized Peritonitis
chief_complaint: Severe left lower abdominal pain that started yesterday and is getting worse
physical_findings: guarding and rebound tenderness in left lower quadrant
treatment: possible CT-guided drainage if abscess enlarges
prognosis: Good with prompt treatment, though 20-30% recurrence risk
description: Inflammation of colonic diverticula with microperforation causing localized peritoneal irritation. Common in patients with chronic diverticulosis. This case shows early abscess formation requiring close monitoring.
